og.title: About Company
og.description:
GC Brains, with the people or corporates it serves, establishes a long-term
ground with mutual trust that makes it possible to work with love and
ownership, and on this ground it does better together.

children.value:
The company, originally named İkinoktabir, was established in 2014 by Cihan to
provide his professional services independently. In 2019, Gülnur joined the
company as a partner, and it became a legal entity dedicated to serving the
separate professional services of both Gülnur and Cihan.
Each whole transcends its parts and deserves its own name.

After three years of partnership, Gülnur and Cihan realized that their company
deserved a unique identity. In 2022, they decided to rebrand as GC Brains, a
name to represent the experience, skill and vision of its partners.

GC Brains, with the people or corporates it serves, establishes a long-term
ground with mutual trust that makes it possible to work with love and
ownership, and on this ground it does better together.

Throughout my career, I've experienced various aspects of building software and
I believe every one of them is as important as the others. I raise awareness of
these aspects so my customers know where their resources are actually used.
How to make good engineering habits that are unique to the company itself
How to understand and adopt programming skills that are accepted worldwide
How to create short and meaningful increments of software
How to design a quality software that works
How to build a solid team culture that sustains for years

How to keep total cost of ownership low to deliver even years after the first
increment

I love to think about these topics, to try and learn while delivering working
software.

contents.title: Cihan - Bio
contents.description:
I'm working hard to establish a network with hard-working, dedicated,
specialized people who love what they do and are open to collaborate.

children.value:
I'm working hard to establish a network with hard-working, dedicated,
specialized people who love what they do and are open to collaborate.

I've founded a software development studio called Mouseless. Here, we work
together to explore ways of developing software. We learn everyday while
delivering working software to our clients.
Making things better, together with the people I love to work with.

This break was planned to be 6 months, but on the 4th month I decided to extend
it until the end of 2021.

I started to work as a part-time consultant to keep internal framework
up-to-date and to help Head of Engineering and the team of Tech-Leads in any
decision they make.

After almost 7 years in Multinet | Up family, I decided to have a sabbatical
leave. During this time I've built a strong interest in philosophy. This
interest helped me to comprehend what I have experienced as a professional.
I have grown and matured as a professional.

I led the organizational transformation of Inventiv to create an engineering
culture enabling company to shift its vision from being a service provider to
become a software vendor. 5 development teams with 30+ engineers delivered
product increments using two week iterations and constantly improved their
quality through engineering metrics.

Worked as a Software Architect to help ProceedLabs from its ideation stage to
its exit. Built a strong development team with a solid technical infrastructure
and implemented Scrum to create the product. Company successfully pivoted a
couple of times to find a better product market fit.

During its ideation stage we moved company's strategy from being an SME
software to a platform for SMEs to find providers and services. It was named as
OfisPaneli. This first version was developed using Angular.js and the .NET
back-end framework I developed for Multinet | Up.

After 3 years of hard work, OfisPaneli was acquired by Groupe Up. Proceed was
born out of OfisPaneli. It became a SaaS company to enable Groupe Up, operating
in 28 countries, to apply its successful business model to the subsidiaries
across the globe. Following this, back-end system was moved to AWS and
front-end was completely redesigned and rewritten in Vue.js.

As the Software Architect my main responsibility was to enable teams to create
high quality software with compliance to group standards and business needs. In
this period we commercialized our internal framework which led the company to
decide to create more software products.

As of 2023, this framework still serves the company in its software solutions
with millions of transactions every day and thousands of tests running for
every build.

Worked as a Software Architect to create a back-end framework in .NET. This
framework is designed with OOP principles and testability in mind. Multinet |
Up moved its legacy system from stored procedures to this modern architecture
while delivering new features and services to its customers and users.

Because of the success of this framework in helping developers to create a
robust software in a short time, Multinet | Up decided to expand its usage to
all of the new projects as well.

I've taken this time to think and decide what to do next in my professional
career. During this period I've started to develop an open-source service
framework which served as the building block of what I was about to create in Multinet | Up.
I was a young-blood and went with the flow to the unknown.

After 3 years of Scrum experience both in turn-key projects and consultancies,
I attended PSD TTT event held in São Paulo, Brazil in 2011 and became a
Professional Scrum Trainer in Scrum.org.

I worked as a trainer for a couple of years in ACM and Scrum.org, but left this
career path along with agile consultancy.
ACM - Co-Founder, Director of Software Engineering

As three young engineers, we were struggling to fit in and never stopped to
dream about having our own company and working together. So we decided to make
it happen and ACM was born.

Our company needed to survive, so we did two things; turn-key projects and
outsourcing. This was even worse than working for a regular company. That's
when we've discovered Agile Manifesto.
ACM later became by far the most respected Agile Consultancy company in Turkey.
I love to help people, but I hate being an outsider, it needs to be hands-on

I love to create something new, but I hate doing it on an excel sheet, it
needs to be the thing itself

I love to make things efficient, but I hate it when it is not visible, it
needs to be for the people who can appreciate it

From Ankara back to Istanbul, I didn't know what I should do. One thing was for
sure, I needed to earn money to be free.

Started as a software engineer and joined a GIS project written in .NET.  With
the architecture of this project in mind, I was asked to create a framework
that would serve other .NET projects in the company. This was the start of my
journey to become a software architect.

I worked in several Java EE based GIS applications as well. One of them was to
port a desktop app to web using JSF, for which I developed a component library
in JS from scratch.

I neither managed to create a standard framework nor a component library for
the company, instead they started to use Oracle's ADF. At the time I thought
this was a failure, but later I realized it was a successful attempt to create
something new.

This was my first professional experience where I learned C# and .NET. I didn't
stay at this place for a long time. I remember having good relationships with
my co-workers, enjoying being a junior and having fun.
A lucky student with a high potential.

I've studied Computer Science which was pretty easy for me. Hard part was
adapting to life in Ankara, alone. Somehow it turned out great. I've made a lot
of friends and get socialized. Very fun period of my life.
High school wasn't fun for me at all. I had not fit in.

I don't remember much about these years. We were in Acıbadem. I was sick most
of the time and I had a Commodore 64.

links.text: ACM - Co-Founder, Director of Software Engineering

contents.title: Footer
contents.description: İkinoktabir Yazılım Danışmanlık San. ve Tic. Ltd. Şti

children.value: İkinoktabir Yazılım Danışmanlık San. ve Tic. Ltd. Şti
Suadiye Mah. Çolak İsmail Sok. No:48/2 K:4 D:8

og.description: Director of Engineering and Product, Coyotiv

children.value: Director of Engineering and Product, Coyotiv

Since studying computer science, I have been intrigued by the bigger picture of software delivery processes. In the first decade, I took on various roles in corporate companies, including software developer, quality assurance engineer, solution architect, business analyst, and project manager. I experienced the processes and operations of projects led by large teams.

In the second decade of my career, I have been involved in product ideation and development processes in startups. With a strong belief in creating software in innovative ways, I became interested in approaches such as Lean Startup and Agile. Following this curiosity, I worked as a consultant, designing processes for numerous companies, teams, and departments, while continuing to learn and experiment. Throughout this journey, I honed my skills in facilitation, coaching, and teaching.

After years of working as a consultant, I have now returned to the forefront, leading cross-functional, self-organized teams to deliver software. This time, I have decision-making authority to expand our experimentation and push the boundaries of what's possible. I am working under pressure to deliver results, but I am excited to take on this new challenge.
Director of Engineering and Product in Collaboration Services
Developing and Executing Collaboration Services Strategy
Leading the organisational design, cultural change and engagement
Designing and improving processes for collaboration and productivity
June 2014 - December 2021 (7 years 7 months) Istanbul, Turkey
As an Agile Coach, I offer the following services:

Conduct trainings and workshops to introduce Agile mindset, frameworks and
approaches like Agile, Scrum, Kanban, Scrum of Scrums, Spotify Model.

Designed and facilitated trainings and workshops to improve the skillset and
knowledge of specific roles such as Product Owner, Scrum Master, Chapter Lead,
Tribe Lead, Agile Coach.

Facilitate and guide teams through rituals, tools and techniques like Sprint
Planning, Retrospectives, STATIK, OKR, PI Planning.

Encourage open communication, feedback, experimentation, and learning, and
coach teams to address conflicts, build trust.

Foster transparency with metrics and coach teams to evaluate their progress.
Address areas for improvement and create a plan for continuous growth.

Identify barriers to Agile adoption and generate a strategic plan for
addressing them, and share findings as reports.

As an Enterprise Agile Coach & Agile Consultant, I provide the following
services:

Conduct awareness workshops for C-Level and Coach them for Agile Leadership
mindset.

Establish Agile Transformation Team and coach them while implementing their
transformation strategy

Identify barriers to Agile transformation, set up governance systems with
Agile Transformation team for addressing them
Sep 2014 - May 2018 · 3 yrs 9 mos, Istanbul, Turkey
Tart New Media / Startup Kitchen  Project Manager
November 2011 - November 2013 (2 years 1 month), Istanbul, Turkey
Experimenting on Lean Startup and Agile practices

Designing processes and facilitating cross-functional teams according to
learnings from the experiments

Understanding business needs and translate them into detailed requirements
that can be used by the development team

Collaborating with development team to design solution, clarify requirements
and getting feedback from stakeholders

Facilitating communication between different departments and managing
micro-projects.

Installation/Integration/testing of systems and solutions for different
customers in Billing&Charging Mediation projects.

Requirement analysis, solution design, time planning, acceptance test
procedure

Conducting integration and performance tests, managing change requests, and
identifying and managing defects throughout the software development lifecycle
Analyzing production defects and providing recommendations for improvements
Collaborating with development teams to ensure a high-quality software product

Software Developer
December 2003 - December 2004 (1 year 1 month)

Developing web application and  rf barcode scanner screens of Logistics
warehouse management system.
